info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 5:25AM EST until January 13 at 8:12AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... Meherrin River At Emporia affecting Greensville, Southampton and City of Emporia Counties. For the Chowan Basin...including Emporia...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Meherrin River at Emporia. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Flood waters infiltrate sewer system. The parking lot next to the ball fields in EGRA Park begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 22.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 23.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.4 feet on 12/26/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 530 PM EST.
